item.title: These cars are parked on a pavement near my flat where tickets have been issued to other cars parked previously, 11th June

item.title: Bexleyheath Town Centre Sign, 11th June
item.description:
Outside Poundstretcher, Broadway, Bexleyheath, DA6 7HF: A pedestrian sign for Bexleyheath Town Centre has been vandalised whereby the glass has shattered as seen in the attached picture. Please could the glass be replaced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadway, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal Poster, 11th June
item.description:
Avenue Road at the junction with Broadway, Bexleyheath: Please remove an illegal poster which is advertising driveway/patio services from the Council’s street light column. Please prosecute this prolific offender who continues to advertise their business illegally around the Bexley Borough.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avenue Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please could you put up some more signs in Ashmore Road, Bravington Road, Denholm Road, Fernhead Road, Fordingley Road, Portnal Road Saltram Crescent and Shirland Road, encouraging dog owners to clean up after their dogs., 10th June
item.description:
Please could you put up some more signs in Ashmore Road, Bravington Road, Denholm Road, Fernhead Road, Fordingley Road, Portnal Road, Saltram Crescent and Shirland Road. Encouraging dog owners to clean up after their dogs. Some signs have been removed by dog owners who have taken offence. These individuals are grossly irresponsible! These streets are vast becoming a cesspit!! Warlock Road is also a road that needs some of these signs to be put up encouraging dog owners to clean up after their dogs. I feel that if possible, could you send some of your Wardens, to keep an eye on things in these streets. The culprits need to be caught and banged to rights!!Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dunsmure Road N16 needs cleaning, 10th June
item.description:
The entire street top to bottom needs cleaning on Dunsmure, especially the south side. Every week loads of rubbish and litter is strewn up and down the street. It is worse on recycling days. Can you please have someone clean weekly as it’s a constant mess

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunsmure Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please could put up some more signs on Fernhead Road opposite St Luke's Church of England primary school encouraging dog owners to clean up after their dogs., 10th June
item.description:
Please could you put up some signs opposite St Luke's Church of England primary school encouraging dog owners to clean up after their dogs. There needs to be some signs on both sides of Fernhead Road. Because this is becoming a problem again. Some of the signs that have been put up have been taken down, or moved to the level of the pavement by irresponsible dog owners who have taken offence. Fernhead Road is particularly bad with dog fouling especially towards the middle end of Fernhead Road and towards the Harrow Road end. More signs need to be put up. In a bid to clean up Fernhead Road. Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extreme Extreme wet wet dog fouling on the pavement which is in front of the phone box on Fernhead., 10th June
item.description:
Extreme Extreme wet wet dog fouling on the pavement which is in front of the phone box on Fernhead Road. Opposite St Lukes Church of England primary school. This is near to the Queens Park end of Fernhead Road. The whole area needs a through wash down because the fouling has been trodden in!! Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Maryon grove is neglected, 10th June
item.description:
The trees and shrubs at the edges are out of control and we have had a spate of drug users hanging around. I walk my dogs and scared of needles and other hazardous waste. Also someone has cut the trees and dumped the large branches where they fell. It’s pretty grim

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 124, Woodhill, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet
